description: The article draws parallels between the fragmentation of the physical and virtual worlds, emphasizing how the internet's fragmentation mirrors tectonic shifts. It discusses the types of internet fragmentation—technical, governmental, and commercial—while examining past internet ideals and the pragmatic future of a broken yet invaluable internet.
